newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine trade gap $49 million in May.
newsitem.headline: Argentine trade gap $49 million in May.

text.p: Argentina posted a $49 million trade deficit in May compared with a $471 million trade surplus in May 1996, the Economy Ministry said Tuesday.
Exports in May rose to $2.48 billion from $2.39 billion in May 1996, while imports climbed to $2.53 billion from $1.92 billion, the Ministry said in a statement.
In the first five months of 1997, Argentina posted a trade deficit of $1.04 billion compared with a surplus of $423 million in January through May of 1996, it said.
Exports in the first five months rose to $10.42 billion from $9.14 billion while imports jumped to $11.46 billion from $8.72 billion.
